I would only add that if you donâ€™t mind staying in a solid three star hotel for your other travel, you will find Kahana Falls suitable for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hale Kipa Unit and Resort Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DGLions
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kahana Falls Resort, Feb 22 - Feb 29. What a wonderful surprise. Our unit 112 (Hale Kipa) was clean, no bugs, nice furniture, comfortable beds. We had what seemed our own hot tub just on the side of our building. It was clean and no one seemed to know about it. We enjoyed doing our own Bar-B-Que which was near the hot tub. The laundry facilities in the same area were FREE, two washers and dryers. Parking is free and pleanty of spaces available. The welcome Mai Tai party was very enjoyable which was held by the main pool area. Free Mai Tais and snacks. All the staff from the front desk to the maids were very pleasant and helpful. The activities personnel were very interested in making your outings enjoyable and affordable. There is even a free business center, where we checked our email daily. A couple of nice restaurants are just a short walking distance (1 block) from the resort. We have a timeshare that week in that unit and are so looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: DGMNB
Reviews.Content: The resort is old and rundown; it was supposed to have been upgraded two years ago. Obviously the owners do not want to invest the money. We had the misfortune of staying in their so called "studio" room which was smaller than a university dorm room. Small is an understatement for this room: there was no place to put our luggage, the appliances were old and cheap, the mattress, bedcovers and rugs should have been changed 10 years ago. There was a small table and two chairs pushed into the corner of the room, but inorder to sit at the table one person had to sit partly into the bathroom. The location of the resort was good and was close to some nice restaurants. The pool was small and not very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Travelsforcoffee
Reviews.Content: This resort is in need of major updates and renovation. While we were there they were replacing some of the floors of the unit next to ours but not any of the furniture, which was old and dirty. THe beds were not very comfortable. We had a two bedroom lock-off unit that faced the pool and could see a bit of ocean if you leaned over the rail in one of the far corners of the lanai. In the front bedroom on the morning of the first day, there was a roach on the wall near the ceiling. We contacted the front desk and someone came up immediately to remove it. We didn't see anymore during the trip but yuk! The pool was nice but the weather was not nice enough for us to use it much as it was rainy and windy in Kahana most of our trip. (A vendor at the arts and crafts fair told us that Kahana is the "cold" side of the island). There was a beach across the street that was nice at the Sands of Kahana. However, it did rain quite a bit in Kahana so we went down to a toddler friendly beach about a mile away by the Farmer's Market--also good for snorkeling where it suprisingly was not raining. There was also a good beach in Lahaina (about 10 miles south) where the weather was always sunny and there was a very baby and kid friendly beach and many, many shops and restaurants. The good thing about Kahana Falls is the staff. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The Concierge---CIndy- was great! She even drove my parents down the street one day when it was raining so they didn't have to walk in the rain (my husband and I had the car).

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: wonderfultotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10-year anniversary as a RCI exchange. When we first checked in the person working at the front desk was so rude that it was shocking. She tried to make a copy of my driver's license and credit card on the copy machine when I wasn't watching. When I requested an explanation of why she needed that, the only thing she could come up with is that if we lost our keys we would have to show our ID to get a new one if we didn't let her keep the copy. I didn't feel comfortable with the situation and asked for the copy (would much rather show my ID if I lost my key). She crinkled it up and put in the trash (which doesn't take care of the problem). I asked her for the copy again and she said No, it's fine. I asked for a third time and she finally gave it to me and was VERY RUDE. I felt like she was trying to scam me. I travel a lot for work and pleasure and have never experienced such a rude check in or someone trying to make a copy of my driver's license. Needless to say, it wasn't a good first impression or a way to start out our vacation. The rudeness in which we encountered can't even be expressed here in words to do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to call home in Maui”
Reviews.Author: 4tobin
Reviews.Content: I was leary about this resort from the comments I read here. I can't stress enough how wrong the reviews are. Kahana Falls was beautiful roomy clean and insect free. The staff was great and the grounds could not be more beautiful. We enjoyed a week in a one bedroom two bath lock off condo with a a beautiful view of the pool and obstructed view of the ocean. We would definitely stay here again, and are strongly considering purchasing here. With all the island of Maui has to offer the location of Kahana Falls could not be more convienient. Minutes from some of the best beaches and shopping on Maui. With Lahaina town a short drive down the road the dining options were endless. Kahana Falls is great for families, Friends, or granparents. If you have the chance we strongly suggest a visit. The Tobin Family

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGilbert_AZ
Reviews.Content: Maui was beautiful.........but this was the worst place I have ever stayed in my life!!!!!!! Room was so small you have to go out in the hall to turn around. We got an upgrade and it was worse than the small room. We could hear the people above drop a spoon and just about every work they said. Terrible....I suggest they should close the place down!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like spacious rooms, seek another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ksilver105
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the smallest hotel room I have stayed during my many years of travel. The only window was facing the breezeway in the hallway. No ocean, no garden view. Very disappointing. First time that I have ever lived in a dungeon for a week. Now I know how those enemy combatants feel like in Gitmo. Other than the room, the resort is adequate. Across the street from a beach, although not the nicest one around. Small pool and spa. Free Washer/Dryer for the guests a plus. Place is clean and staff friendly. Location is good near sights etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: bogueplayer
Reviews.Content: This is similar to a old Motel 6 or an OLD Super 8. Everything in my room needs to be changed. I can't beleive that they rated this as a 3 star resort. It is more like a 1 star. A complete and disgusting DUMP. Be Warned!

Reviews.Title: “Kahana Falls”
Reviews.Author: TDSGOLF
Reviews.Content: Kahana Falls -- December 12th 2006 We had the unfortunate luck to have to stay at one of the hotel rooms at the Kahana Falls Resort last week. By the time we booked our room these were the only rooms available, according to what they said. The only good thing about the resort that we could see was the staff are very polite and helpful. We asked about a posible upgrade to a larger room and were told that the upgraded room would cost $30.00 more a night and has a sofa bed as the sleeping accomodations! If you go to Kahana Falls make sure you have at least a decent size room.

Reviews.Title: “Badly In Need of Remodel”
Reviews.Author: Wolf1955
Reviews.Content: Returned to Kahana Falls in August 2006. We had stayed there in 2001 and thought it was a very nice resort. We had a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit both times. This time, however, the units had an ant and a roach problem. The first time they sprayed automatically each week - not so this time, they just gave us a can of bug spray. The beds were horrible. They were thin, lumpy and very uncomfortable! The bathroom was run down and the countertops and cabinets were in very shabby condition. The entire unit needed a remodel and upgrade. They have lost their RCI Gold Crown rating, but are still advertising themselves as a luxury resort when they are worse at this time than a hotel. They need to make upgrades, especially with regard to the beds and linens, in order to keep people coming back! I was very disappointed this time! Definitely not what it used to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: tbirdie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom, two bath unit and it was very comfortable and exactly what we needed. I enjoyed this property very much. It is small and quiet. The two bedrooms are large, they have a full kitchen, dining room table, living room, with a spacious lanai (balcony) stackable washer/dryer, and two full bathrooms. The bedroom without a bath attached also had a kitchenette and the sofa in the living room has a pull out sleeper. We did not use this, but if you need it, it is there. The grounds were well kept and the fresh water pool was great (but small and a little cold) It was very tropical and the jacuzzi had a sand bottom- that was neat. We would love to return! Thank you Kahana Falls!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChattyKitty
Reviews.Content: We were finally able to trade our RCI week for one in the Maui location we wanted but were only able to get the "hotel room" available. Reading some of the reviews made us very nervous about the size and lack of window so we were very pleased when we checked in. The room was very nice, large enough for two and the jacuzzi tub was a great bonus. We had a microwave, fridge and toaster and could warm up simple meals. The grounds are beautiful, landscaped and maintained very well. We always had a comfortable place to sit and especially liked to take a dip in the hot tub and pool at night with the tiki torches and lights creating a lovely atmosphere. There were places to bar-b-que and eat outdoors, great for those of us without a kitchen. Everyone around us seemed to be enjoying themselves. The staff was wonderful. The resort was small but so nice we are considering buying a unit on the resale market. Yes, not having a lanai or view did detract from the location but we were grateful to finally spend a wonderful week in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: eylchu
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience in my life. We first booked a smaller one bedroom in the back but when we went to look at it, it reeked of bug spray and the room was tiny. I don't even know how they can call that a one bedroom. So we upgraded to a bigger one bedroom on the 3rd floor. The room is a nice size and that's about all I can say about it. We had a roach problem in the room -- we had a few crawling around the living room and one woke up my husband in bed as it crawled up his arm! Needless to say we were both very traumatized and would never stay here again. We spoke with the hotel but they said it was normal to have roaches since it was a tropical island. They were also in the process of spraying the entire complex during our stay. Needless to say the smell was offensive and uncomfortable. We've been to Maui and other islands many times without encountering a roach in our hotel! In addition to the roach problem, the furniture was old. The bathroom was also very old. And the facilities were all very small. The pool is barely bigger than a kid size pool. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room is like a Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: sinasohn
Reviews.Content: Problems we encountered: 1. The "hotel type" unit was absolutey tiny and very dark with little to no light, especially as there was no window. There was one small window to a dark lobby. 2. The ceiling fan which was supposed to be fixed in 30 minutes didn't get fixed until the second day. 3. I saw ants in the room. 4. When that small window was open, you heard the loud sound in the room of what appeared to be a very old AC unit. 5. While the manager was professional in her concern for the guest, the night desk clerk who worked there was EXTREMELY rude and made we waste a lot of time very much ruining my vacation mode for a few hours. I was shocked at what he told me. 6. No patio or lanai to open up door to get some fresh air. Just closed off walls (e.g., the dungeon feeling). Not on the beach, but I did know this so it was not there fault. 7. Was disappointed that they had another room, a studio, that they would not allow me to use even though it was available. They did let me stay there for one night but I basically had to move mountains to make this happen. As a very experienced business and personal traveler, I believe good management would have made the room upgrade at no charge. They wanted to charge me $35 per day. 8. Toilet was not working properly as it would run. 9. Room in general, could definitely use a face lift (e.g., AC, television was very small, bathroom outdated, carpets) Positives: 1. I bought last minute over the internet and only paid $275 for the week. Otherwise I would have been extremely angry. I guess it once again proves, you get what you pay for. By the way, this is the first time I have ever written a review of a resort and I have stayed at a lot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Small resort, but very nice!”
Reviews.Author: shorty20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Kahana Falls for a week while on our honeymoon, and had a wonderful time. The resort is small, but very clean and well kept. The pool was warm, beautiful and very relaxing. I can not say enough about the front desk staff, one gentlemen in particular, who was very helpful. He gave us great advice on wonderful little places to eat and visit that we would never have found on our own. The room was small, but had everything we needed for a great stay. My only complaint was the slamming doors. Our neighbors left every morning at about 6am, and woke us because the doors do not catch themselves and close quietly. Other than that, I have no complaints. It was also close to restaurants, which was very nice. If you're looking for a 4 Seasons or Ritz Carlton type place, don't stay here, but if you want a low key relaxing vacation, I recommend Kahana Falls.

Reviews.Title: “great little resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kahana Falls is a wonderful place to stay. It's quiet and relaxing and very friendly. If you're looking for a 5 star resort as in Hyatt or Westin.........this isn't it. Of course you won't be paying those prices either. The staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge are incredible.. very good, know their stuff. Betty, Kathleen and Jeremy are the best, they took care of us from start to finish. They told us that the price wouldn't be the cheapest .....but we got the best service and the best recommendations. You get what you pay for. The person who found a cheaper Helicopter tour probably got a cheaper helicopter tour. . The concierge recommend the best companies and then they offer great discounts on those. If you want to go with a cheaper tour......they will book it for you but..........don't complain later. Everything we did was top notch. Kahana Falls is a fun place to stay........we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel unit”
Reviews.Author: Stag88
Reviews.Content: We traded 2 hotel weeks at Kahana Falls from June 1-8, and June 8-15. Both RCI and resort's websites warned us that the room is very small, 276 sq ft. Since we don't intend to stay in the room for too long, we confirmed the request. We don't usually cook while on vacation. A hotel room with light kitchen is good enough for us. The first week we stay in room 105B. The room is smaller than average hotel room. The bathroom is quite large with 2 basins. There is a microwave, an under-counter fridge, a small bar sink, and utensils enough for 2 people. The dining table is very tiny about 3 feet in diameter with 2 small chairs. When we pull out a chair, it blocks the entrance door. The window is facing the hallway. So we had to close the shutter most of the time. The resort is in a very convenient location. There is a public beach (Kahana Beach) access path immediately across the street, next to Sands of Kahana. Pohaku Beach is about 2-3 minutes walk. The second week we were assigned to room 605B. The front desk told us to pack everything and leave in 105B. They will move the luggage to 605B when it was available. The setup of 605B is identical to 105B. This unit has a good view of the mountain. Once again, the window faces the hallway. All hotel room units have no sitting area. If we wanted to watch TV, we had to sit on bed. The furniture layout plan in Kahana Falls' website is not in proportion that gave us a false impression. Our neighbor occupied a studio unit. By combining the studio and the hotel room, they form a one bedroom unit. The studio is quite roomy because it contains a pull out bed. It also has a lanai and a good size of dining table with 4 chairs, a full kitchen and a dishwasher. We donâ€™t mind to go back to Kahana Falls. If we have a choice, we would request a studio or a one bedroom unit. But a hotel room is just fine for us too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room - Very Small”
Reviews.Author: sierrasue50
Reviews.Content: We knew we were going to be in a very small room, but were taken aback when we walked in. It is SO TINY. The door when opened, hit the chair, and there was barely room between the bed and the kitchen to stand. And NO window. Well, that's not exactly true. The window was about 1.5 feet high, and 5 feet or so long, with shutters, but looked out onto the hallway by the parking lot. The bathroom was GREAT! Huge big jacuzzi tub, 2 sinks, and Lots of room!! All that being said, the grounds were beautiful, as stated by many others. Waterfalls cascading into the pools, and lots of lush gardens. Two Barbeques were available, and there were laundry facilities in a separate building. The concierge staff were very helpful - attended the welcome orientation meeting and booked a couple of activities. I called this "room" the Dungeon in Paradise. So, if you can get one of the larger rooms do so. But I'd still go back even if it was the only room available again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui No Ka Oi”
Reviews.Author: Kapulanikai
Reviews.Content: Maui is the best and what makes partly makes it so is the Kahana Falls. A timeshare place that's a cut about the rest with a great staff, super accomodation, great grounds and a free form pool that while not big (in fact, tiny) is a joy to behold. If you're an architect then go to this place to see how many buildings can be squeezed into so little space and it doesn't look crowded. Be warned that there is no ocean view and there's a bit of noise from the constant plane traffic at the airport only a couple of blocks away but then you'll want to get in your rental car and drive down to where ten of the worl'ds best beaches are located south of Kihei and Wailea, particularily Makena (big and little) and Ulua beaches. Enjoy your trip to Kahana Falls and Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but beware of snoopy maids.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort this was. We stayed here 4/13/06-4/20/06. We we in the 2 bedroom/2 bath on the bottom level (Aloha tower) that had a great pool view. We didn't spend much time in our room, but it was a great place to sleep, shower and relax. We loved the sand bottomed jacuzzi and the pool which was surrounded by waterfalls. Paradise!! We participated in the free Hula workout but missed the lei making, boohoo. Our hula teacher invited us to watch her free show at the Ka'Anapali beach resort, it was fun. You recieve a mid week cleaning, they do the dishes, change sheets, more towels, ect. We also had to vacate one day for a few hours, ug, for the bug lady. We did have p--- ants in the bathrooms. Still saw some after the bug spray, no biggie. We live in Florida and are used to those critters. Our only complaint was that during two of our daily towel exchanges the maids help themselves to my Pineapple Wine in the fridge (I noticed two long black hairs closed in the cork, and my mother and I both have light blond hair) and they tried on my lip gloss (They blotted on a tissue and left it on the counter, and I have never blotted my lipstick in my life) and they tried on my mothers lotion in her bathroom. We notified the front desk and they are going to investigate which maids cleaned our room on those days. So to detour them the rest of our vacation I locked up my toiletries and jewelery in the safe and went ahead and finished my wine. Kathleen the concerge was so helpful. They cut you a small discount and help out with dinner reservations and activities. Mom left her a Thank you card. Overall we really loved our resort and location. JJust make sure you lock up your personal unless you want somebody snooping. Or better yet, just put the "Do Not Disturb" on the door.

Reviews.Title: “AQuiet Beautiful piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We lived on Maui for several years and now take a yearly visit back to enjoy the island and friends. We love Kahana Falls. They are in the middle of a total renovation of the rooms and should be done by summer 2006. We stayed in the 2 bedroom lockout this time and it was perfect for 4 people. Its location in wonderful-walking to shopping and dining and a short drive to the large market. Lahaina and Kaanapali is just a few minutes by car. The complex is also very quiet and peaceful and the staff has been very accomodating and friendly. Can't believe another reviewer found the staff lacking. There is a small beach across the street--but get in your car and find the beautiful beachs all along the Maui coast. Just a short distance away is Napili with gorgeous sand beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Touring Maui”
Reviews.Author: stayput
Reviews.Content: Because of some of the negative reviews on here, I was very nervous about visiting Kahana Falls. It turned out that I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and efficient. We had a one bedroom unit with daily maid service. No bugs. There is public access to the beach across the street, and the beach is sand, not rocks. There is a great coffee shop within walking distance, as well as various other types of restaurants. The place is beautifully landscaped and the pool is small, but nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quick review of the Kahana Falls Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Kahana Falls resort for 8 days and 7 nights at the end of August, 2005. The only reason why Iâ€™m writing this review is because before our trip to Maui I read reviews that scared me. I have read reviews stating that there are bugs in the rooms, I can tell you honestly that our 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen were very very clean (NO BUGS, someone had to been very unlucky or dirty). We stayed on the second floor just above the waterfall, our balcony was overlooking the pool which was very nice and we could see a little bit of the ocean far away. Number one thing that is a must in maui is a car. Without a car you are stuck, there are not a lot of things to do in Kahana (Lahaina). If you had a car you could drive 15 minutes to a near by city (i don't remember the name sorry) there are lots of activities and shopping there. The resort is not very big but its CLEAN. The people who work there are nice. The workers who sit in the main lobby and are supposed to find the best deals on activities for you, in my suggestion don't find the best deals. If you look around i guarantee youâ€™ll find better deals then what they are offering (We did, $150 cheaper for a helicopter ride by the same company). If you like to hike, I suggest you buy a guidebook. I bought a book called Maui Revealed, which talked about many hidden trails that lead to water blowholes, waterfalls, swinging bridges, to zip lining through the jungle that normally you wouldnâ€™t find. Ohh yeah grab a good pair of hiking shoes. We did everything from scuba diving to parasailing (Great Times!!!). We had a great time and would definitely go back! Check out the pictures i took of the resort. Enjoy your stay. I would be happy to answer any questions you might have via e-mail. Please make the subject: Maui questions, otherwise I won't open the email. Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Kahana Falls a LET DOWN !”
Reviews.Author: bellavita1
Reviews.Content: Kahana Falls Resort is NOT a resort, but an OK hotel with very, very nice (but small grounds, with a very, very small pool). There's nothing to do there and it is a far drive from anywhere. You are neither on a beach (but you do have a great view of the hotel across the street -- :( nor is the closest beach even swimmable, since it is all ROCKS! The front desk and the concierge/activity director were both cold and aloof and arrogant. The only good thing was the cleaning staff! We would not recommend this resort. Unbelievable that RCI considers this a Gold Crown timeshare resort. Just unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from Kahana Falls to England and had a fantastic holiday. Kahana Falls is a quiet hotel but very nice, the accomodation is spacious and very clean. Pool area has a small pool but is compensated by lovely waterfalls, very relaxing place to stay. The whole place is lovely and clean and well kept with beautiful landscape. Staff are very nice and always happy to help. Every room overlooks the the pool. Good location for getting around. Car a must. Will defiently go back to Kahana Falls.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Fun”
Reviews.Author: wschaaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kahana Falls early May this year. Best thing about Kahana is the free-form pool and spa area. This area is very nicely landscaped, looks very natural. Easy to relax there. We stayed in a 2 bedroon, 2 bath unit in the Falls building. The Falls building faces towards the ocean, and on the 4th floor you get sort of a view of the water between two other resort buildings. The entire grounds are very well kept up. The rooms are acceptable in size, but to get a two bedroom, you get the one bedroom lock out studio along with the full one bedroom unit. The small studio has a bath and small kitchen area w/coffee maker, microwave, and small refridge. I would be hard pressed to spend an entire week in this small area. No view through small windows overlooking parking lot. Staff is very pleasant. On-site activity center was convienent, and offer discounts to most activites. Walking distance up the street are at least two good restaurants (Roys and Outback), along with a Shell station and McDonalds. Lahaina is a short 10 minute drive from Kahana. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews I was interested to see what this was really like. So, I was pleasantly surprised to find Kahana Falls was, indeed, a Gold Crown Resort. Now, if you are looking for a large, activity driven, resort then Kahana Falls is not for you. It is small but it is very restful and a wonderful place to stay. For those who stayed in a "hotel room" I would agree that the rooms are very small. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was plenty spacious. There was a large living area with a hide-a-bed couch. There were one very nice sized bedroom (with bath) that would be the master. The smaller bedroom could be locked off and was what someone would have if they just had the "hotel room." The pool is small but very pleasant. The sand bottom hot tubs (two of them) were very nice. I have found that you usually find the kind of people that you are looking for. I found the staff to be very helpful and very gracious. They seemed genuinely pleased that we were there and wanted to make our stay comfortable. To tell you the truth, I found it to have much more of a local feel than a resort feel. It's all in what you are looking for. If you are looking for an amusement park environment then you need to go somewhere else. If you are looking for a nice, quiet, restful piece of Maui....this place may be for you. It was great and we will go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Kahana Falls
HotelInfo.Address: 4260 Lower Honoapiilana Rd, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
